1425133417507737601.text:
⚡️Energy/Natural Resources⚡️
 
🔘Provides $ for abandoned mine site clean-up.
🔘$ for a new program to clean up orphaned oil & gas wells.
🔘Boosts carbon capture infrastructure.
🔘Bolsters domestic critical mineral supply
🔘Critical mineral permitting reform on federal land.

1425133416748625921.text:
✈️ Airports ✈️
 
🔘$2.48 billion overall in primary airports annually for 5 years.
🔘$20 million overall under the @FAANews Contract Tower Program annually for 5 years.
🔘$ for general aviation and commercial services annually for 5 years.
🔘$ for the Airport Terminal Program.

1425133415863570435.text:
📶 Broadband 📶
 
🔘Provides initial funding of at least $100 million for broadband deployment in addition to formula-based funding for WV.
🔘Spurs investment in rural broadband projects.

1425133415087714316.text:
🚰Water and Wastewater🚰
 
🔘@EPWGOP & @EPWCmte water infrastructure bill text.
🔘Largest investment in clean drinking water in U.S. history.
🔘Flexibility for rural states.
🔘$ for Drinking Water & Clean Water State Revolving Funds
🔘$ for lead pipe remediation and PFAS cleanup.

1425133414286569472.text:
🛣Surface Transportation🛣
 
🔘$3 billion+ in highway formula funding over 5 years.
🔘$506 million over 5 years for bridges.
🔘Creation of Rural Surface Transportation Grant Program that awards $2 billion in competitive grants over 5 year period to improve & expand roads/bridges.

1341244613886173184.text: Several #WV priorities have been included in this year’s omnibus. While I’m pleased these passed tonight, we’re months behind schedule. Congress has got to get its act together and take the politics out of our most basic function, funding the government. https://t.co/Yus1aO7OEw https://t.co/CuqsBAOOW7

1341244609767362560.text: I’m glad we passed this tonight, but let’s not forget we could have had this deal this summer. Leading up to this point, Speaker Pelosi admitted she was proud of her all-or-nothing approach and continued to play politics with the pandemic.

1341244607590490117.text:
FINALLY. We passed the #coronavirus relief deal. Help is on the way. Here’s what’s included: 
➡️ $600 stimulus checks
➡️ Enhanced unemployment
➡️ Funding for schools & universities
➡️ Replenished #PPP small biz aid
➡️ Broadband funding https://t.co/MtMGHxARTF

1341201436286304264.text: It also cuts red tape, is fiscally responsible, and strengthens our national security. Learn more: https://t.co/bBvr2Ckzd5 https://t.co/KDilwP3jFa

1341201432251396097.text: WRDA supports our nation’s economic competitiveness by increasing water storage, providing protection from dangerous floodwaters, deepening nationally significant ports, maintaining navigability of inland waterways, & addressing the threat of invasive species across the country.

1341201430716276742.text: Water infrastructure is critical to the health and safety of #WV communities. Learn more about the Water Resources Development Act of 2020, bipartisan legislation included in the omnibus package.

1311449468642959371.text: American families sit down and budget their finances every year. Congress needs to do the same.

1311449466524897280.text: The bottom line is that funding our government by Continuing Resolution is not sustainable and actually wastes resources. We must do better and the best way to accomplish this to work through our process, a bipartisan process at that, to accomplish our shared goals.

1311449464591220737.text: As Chairman of the Homeland Security Subcommittee, I also worked to provide funds for the Disaster Relief Fund that are so critical to respond to any national needs.

1311449462485778435.text: Additionally, this provides a little more certainty and flexibility for our federal workforce, contractors, and the ability to use and apply for federal grants, loans, and research programs, such as @SBAgov Disaster Loans.

1311449460564688897.text: I will continue to work as Chairman of the @EPWGOP Subcommittee on Transportation and Infrastructure to enact long-term reauthorizations for these important economic development programs.

1311449458555715584.text: The good news is that this CR ensures we will not have a damaging government shutdown on October 1. This CR extends the federal highway program and the @ARCgov authorization, both of which would have expired, through September 30, 2021.

1311449455820931074.text: I’m not a big fan of continuing resolutions because I believe Congress should fund the government properly under regular order. However, Senate Democrats broke an agreement to allow us to proceed to marking up our bills as we do every year so here we are.

1311430045299347458.text: We should use this process as an opportunity to inspire that next generation, and we should be proud of the fact that we have an accomplished woman to consider to serve on our nation’s highest court.

1311430044175282176.text: While we are still in the beginning of the confirmation process, Judge Barrett meets the criteria. She’s a fair-minded individual who understands & respects the responsibilities of a Supreme Court justice, & I look forward to watching her confirmation hearings.

1311430041578942465.text: Ultimately, the most important factors in my decision to confirm a Supreme Court nominee are whether the nominee is well-qualified, has a record of applying the original text of our Constitution, and has the support of my fellow West Virginians. https://t.co/4XgHP1XqSX

1242234484323475457.text:
Here’s some of Speaker Pelosi’s demands in her just released #coronavirus bill:

➡️ Language that ensures airline passengers have "information regarding greenhouse gas emissions" https://t.co/MY2UyxZMFI

1242138119991894017.text:
✅ Acting now means $20 billion for veterans health care to make sure we have the resources to care for those who are served.  
🚫 Blocking the bill denies the VA these resources.

1242138119174004737.text:
✅ Acting now means $11 billion to research vaccines and therapies to combat the coronavirus.   
🚫 Blocking the bill delays resources needed to combat the disease.

1242138118301593601.text:
✅ Acting now means 13 weeks of additional unemployment and an additional $600 per week of benefits for workers who are laid off.   
🚫 Blocking the bill denies these benefits to working families.

1242138117471158272.text:
✅ Acting now means payments to help lower-income and middle class families.   
🚫 Blocking the bill means that these families will not receive a much-needed boost.

1242138116628119553.text:
✅ Acting now means offering a lifeline to small businesses that will help them retain workers on their payroll.   
🚫 Blocking the bill gives small businesses nothing and results in more closures and layoffs.

1242138115604692995.text:
✅ Acting now means $1.7 billion to purchase personal protective equipment and medical supplies for the response efforts.   
🚫 Blocking the bill denies funding for this much-needed equipment.

1242138114916855812.text:
✅ Acting now means at least $75 billion for hospitals and medical providers.  
🚫 Blocking the bill leaves them empty handed.

1241879179005657088.text: I will continue working toward a bipartisan agreement that will allow us to pass similar legislation soon, and I urge my colleagues to put politics aside and do the same.

1241879178053668864.text:
➡️ $400 million for FEMA grants for local governments and first responders.
➡️ $10 billion for community development grants to state and local government
➡️ $100 million to expand broadband deployment in rural areas.

1241879176417853440.text:
➡️ $20 billion for the health care of our veterans.
➡️ $20 billion to K-12 and higher education institutions.
➡️ $11 billion for research into vaccines and treatments for COVID-19.
➡️ $5 billion to FEMA to fund the Disaster Relief Fund.

1241879174916308992.text:
➡️ 13 additional weeks of unemployment for individuals who are laid off.
➡️ An additional unemployment benefit of $600 a week on top of the normal unemployment benefit for 12 weeks.

1241879174039638018.text: ➡️ Payments to all lower and middle income families of $1,200 per individual/$2,400 per married couple and $500 per child for individuals earning up to $75,000; single parents earning up to $112,500; and married couples earning up to $150,000.

1241879172663951360.text:
Had tonight’s motion passed, the Senate would have been able to move forward with legislation to provide:
➡️ $75 billion for hospitals and other medical providers.
➡️ A new loan program for small businesses, with loan
forgiveness designed to help keep workers on the payroll.

1241879171401502723.text: Our health care workers need equipment and aid. It’s imperative that we work quickly and get legislation passed soon. The American people are looking for answers, not partisan politics.

1235367297348440064.text: I was proud to vote to confirm both Justice Gorsuch and Justice Kavanaugh, and I am certain that both of them will continue to apply our Constitution and laws as written to reach impartial decisions in the matters before them.

1235367295800750080.text: But it is never appropriate for anyone – especially an elected official who has sworn an oath to uphold our Constitution – to threaten a judge based on the decision he or she might reach in a particular case.

1235367293493919745.text: Last August, I joined with my Republican colleagues to send a letter recognizing the importance of a fair & independent federal judiciary. It is fundamental that all Americans can engage in reasoned debate about individual court cases & criticize decisions they disagree with.

1232432503526322177.text: NEWS: @DeptVetAffairs approved year two of the agritherapy program at the Woody Williams VA Medical Center. This program, which I created in the appropriations process, has seen 17 veterans complete the curriculum, & I'm hoping its continuation will enable more to participate.

1232421138472542210.text: Today, the Senate failed to move forward on a bill that would guarantee that babies born alive after an attempted abortion receive appropriate medical care. The Senate also failed to move forward on a bill that would protect life after 20 weeks.
